etymologies: late 15th century (in an earlier sense). Apparently from Middle French crin hair + -et; compare Old French crignete hair, mane

definitions: A set of segmented metal plates which cover the top and sides of a horse's neck as part of its protective armour. Compare "crinière"; "cranet".

notes.text: The crinet (or criniere) was attached to the chanfron, which protected the horse's head, and the poitrel, which protected its chest.
